info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A gusty shower will impact portions of northwestern Chesterfield, central Nottoway, southeastern Goochland, west central Henrico, eastern Amelia and southeastern Powhatan Counties and the City of Richmond through 200 PM EDT... At 113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty shower centered near Spainville, or near Blackstone, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mannboro around 125 PM EDT. Scotts Fork around 130 PM EDT. Chula around 135 PM EDT. Moseley around 140 PM EDT. Tuckahoe, Bon Air, University Of Richmond, Manakin and Sabot around 200 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Flat Rock, Winterpock, Earls, Pilkinton, Johnsons Springs, Midlothian, Short Pump, Subletts, Winterham and Skinquarter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This shower may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
